section.title: Wh- questions: Who ...? and What ...?
section.sectiontitle: We sometimes use Who + verb + object, to ask about a person.
section.sectiontitle2: We sometimes use What + do/does + subject + verb/object to ask about a thing.
section.text3a: What does Luisa study at university? French and English.

section.title: Wh- questions: When ...? and Where ...?
section.sectiontitle: We sometimes use When + do/does + subject + verb/object to ask about a time.
section.text1a: When do you do your homework? In the evening.
section.sectiontitle2: We sometimes use Where + do/does + subject + verb to ask about a place.
section.text3a: Where does Jane work? She works in London.

section.title: Questions: Why ...? and How many ...?
section.sectiontitle: We use Why + do/does + subject + verb/object to ask about a reason.
section.text1a: Why do you like dancing? Because it's fun!
section.sectiontitle2: We use How many + subject + is/are there to ask about a number.
section.text3a: How many people are there in your family? Seven.
